bibdata.title: Link to digital content does not scroll down the page to viewer
Ensure only one incremental indexing job can run at a time

comments.body:
One solution is:
https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/wiki/Ent-Rate-Limiting#custom-errors

But we don't have an Enterprise license.
 
jroch (ever-present) suggests using the ActiveJob API. Seems like a good option:
https://blog.eq8.eu/til/retry-active-job-sidekiq-when-exception.html#activejob-retry
We might also want to try something like https://github.com/mhfs/sidekiq-failures for better visibility of failed jobs.

bibdata.title: On Reserve Item is not saying it is on reserve

comments.body: @carolyncole the reserves listing has been removed from orangelight and at one point it looked like the alma reserve feature may not be used so we just hard-coded that to 'N' for everything. I'll check on this.
@carolyncole I assume you're asking because it's used in Requests?
Yes, it is used in requests.  We use it to check and see if a person can request a copy.  If it is on reserve is should not be able to be requested for pickup.

> Can we also in this PR remove the line from the indexing documentation that says it needs to be copied? https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blame/alma/docs/indexing.md#L57

oh yes I will remove it.
@hackartisan can you check I removed the doc line and also an old comment for the specific issue.

figgy.title: Intermittent incomplete response error from web server on figgy production

comments.body:
Okay I tried this investigation since lib-proc7 had a PdfOcrJob running since 6 days ago. thread count was 19. Not sure what "pretty high" means but I did see someone on the internet mention 89 threads so it's definitely not as high as that.

Out of curiosity, I checked thread counts on the other boxes. most were in the 16-19 range. Two of them (proc9 and proc11) had a thread count of 1. I restarted workers on a couple of them and they came up with 12 threads.

That said, there wasn't other evidence that the workers had died (i.e. there was nothing in the queue so I couldn't see whether they were still picking up jobs)
